alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 7:52PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Roanoke and northeastern Montgomery Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 745 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mc Donalds Mill to Elliston. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Rainfall to significantly reduce the visibility on Interstate 81 near Elliston, and Highway 460 between Shawsville and Salem. Heavy rain may also wash debris onto the highway, with poor drainage flooding along driveways and culvert pipes. Locations impacted include... Salem... Bent Mountain... Shawsville... Glenvar... Mc Donalds Mill... Elliston-Lafayette... and Poages Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A torrential downpour of rain is occuring with the storm near Elliston. Excessive rainfall may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways and avoid low water crossings. Drivers along Interstate 81 and Highway 460 are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. In addition, look out for cloud to ground lightning. Some of the lightning strikes are occurring where it is not raining. Consider moving indoors or into a vehicle if you can hear thunder.
